required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Clinical Performance of 59% Hioxifilcon A Contact Lenses vs. Marketed Hydrogel Contact Lenses
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Clinical Performance of 59% Hioxifilcon A Daily Disposable Contact Lenses vs. Marketed Daily Disposable Hydrogel Contact Lenses

brief_summary.textblock: The study will compare the short-term clinical performance and wearer and practitioner acceptability of a new-to-market spherical daily disposable (DD) hydrogel soft contact lens to a currently marketed spherical DD hydrogel soft contact lens.

detailed_description.textblock:
This randomized clinical trial will compare the short-term clinical performance, and wearer acceptability of a new-to-market hioxifilcon A spherical daily DD contact lenses against marketed DD lenses in a short cross-over clinical trial.
The primary outcome variable for this study is overall subjective comfort.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomized cross-over with 1 week of lens wear with each contact lens type.
study_design_info.masking_description: Clinician masking achieved by clinic coordinator dispensing lenses. Open label to participants.

primary_outcome.description: Subjective comfort rating on a scale of 0 (Painful) to 10 (Can't feel the lenses)
Subjective comfort rating on a scale of 0 (Painful) to 10 (Can't feel the lenses)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 2 and 3 - Approximately 1 and 2 weeks, respectively
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective comfort rating on a scale of 0 (Painful) to 10 (Can't feel the lenses)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 2 and 3 - Approximately 1 and 2 weeks, respectively
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective vision rating on a scale of 0 (Not at all sharp/clear) to 10 (Sharp/Clear)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Visit 3 - After approximately 2 weeks of contact lens wear
secondary_outcome.description: Forced choice subjective preference for either lens type (1-Day ACUVUE® MOIST or Test DD contact lens) or no preference. i.e. three options presented and participant selects one option.

arm_group.description: 1 week of Test DD contact lenses followed by cross over to 1 week of 1-DAY ACUVUE® Moist contact lenses.
1 week of 1-DAY ACUVUE® Moist contact lenses followed by cross over to 1 week of Test DD contact lenses.

intervention.intervention_name: Hioxifilcon A standard hydrogel contact lens with Hyaluronic Acid (HA)
intervention.description: Daily disposable contact lens wear for 1 week

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Currently wearing spherical DD contact lenses at least 5 days/week
- Vision correctable to 20/30 acuity in each eye with spherical DD contact lenses
- No ocular or systemic disease that contra-indicates soft contact lens wear
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participating in another clinical trial
- Vision not correctable to 20/30
